textos_fuente.text: Cobb's Landing in Fort Pierce City Marina features tiki bar atmosphere News Indian River Martin St. Lucie Sports Advertise Obits eNewspaper Legals DINING Restaurant review: Fort Pierce Cobb’s Landing, like dining in Key West Lucie Regensdorf Special to TCPalm FORT PIERCE — Here, on The Treasure Coast, we are fortunate to have some wonderful waterfront restaurants. A favorite among that cherished group is Cobb’s Landing. The restaurant is located on the Fort Pierce City Marina and has a Margaritaville-tiki-hut atmosphere that is both casual and inviting. There you can dine comfortably outdoors but be under cover from the heat of the sun and the rain of the summer afternoons. The restaurant also has outdoor tables marina-side. The tiki bar is very popular and every time I have visited, the stools are filled with happy patrons enjoying the mojito bar or the daily drink specials. When you walk in it’s as if you have stumbled onto Duval Street in Key West and ordered a Salty Dog. Live entertainment on the weekends completes the fun. Looking for a free mini puzzle? Play the USA TODAY Quick Cross now. We sat at a table in the corner and, partway through dinner, the window flaps were lowered to protect us from a torrential downpour. We stayed dry and comfortable and well-cared for by the staff. The menu is said to be “American cuisine and craft cocktails,” and who could argue with that? Starters include wings, fish dip, fried alligator — I was tempted but was vetoed — and blackened chicken quesadillas. Meals include tacos, burgers, salads, sandwiches, raw bar, fried fish platters, seafood gumbo, tuna poke bowl, tenderloin tips and veggie pastas, to name a few. If you have read any of my reviews, then you will not be surprised that one of the appetizers we ordered was crispy onion strings ($9). Sweet Vidalia onions were thinly sliced, breaded, fried crispy and served with tangy horseradish aioli. The onions were delicious. We also tried the crispy fried Asian calamari ($14). Tender calamari were served on a bed of mixed greens with Asian spices in a sweet chili vinaigrette garnished with sesame seeds. Being off to a good start, we went for the gold. Shrimp and grits ($22) was one diner’s choice. It is featured with a fried egg, but she opted out. The cheesy grits were creamy and rich, the shrimp tender and flavorful and the dish was chock full of sharp, smoky andouille sausage. The “Keys Disease” that afflicts folks in Florida’s southernmost region apparently led my husband to step out of his comfort zone and order a Figgy Burger ($16). I was somewhat concerned about him but our waitress, Taylor, reassured us it was a popular burger. His beef patty was cooked perfectly and topped with goat cheese, bacon and fig sauce. The combination of the tart and tangy goat cheese and the sweet fig jam was like a sunset on Mallory Square, both bizarre and delightful. Rajun Cajun pasta ($18) was another diner’s choice. Perfectly cooked bowtie pasta rocked strips of savory tasty, blackened chicken, chunks of smoky andouille sausage, creamy Cajun sauce and shaved parmesan cheese. I ordered the grilled salmon bowl ($24) because it had everything I loved. Sweet mango salsa and a piquant citrus aioli topped flaky fillets of salmon in a bowl full of white rice, spicy black beans and broccoli. With Key West on our mind, we shared the house-made Key lime pie ($9). A perfectly tart lime and creamy filling on a graham cracker crust with piped whipped cream and a raspberry drizzle and we were transformed. Dining at Cobb’s Landing will make you feel as if you have driven the Seven Mile Bridge to Key West. They offer waterfront dining, fun and engaging staff and a comfortable, open air and laid-back atmosphere. The food menu is seafood-centric but with plenty of options for landlubbers. And they offer drink specials and entertainment. Cobb’s Landing Cuisine: American Cuisine Address: 200 North Indian River Drive, No. 4424, in Fort Pierce Phone: 772-460-9014 Hours: 11 a.m.-10 p.m. Mondays through Saturdays; 11 a.m.-9 p.m. Sundays Alcohol: Full bar Online: www.Cobbs-Landing.com Lucie Regensdorf dines anonymously at the expense of TCPalm for #WhatToDoIn772. Contact her at Lucie@theloveofcooking.com Staff Directory Corrections Careers Accessibility Support Sitemap Legals Public notice certification Our Ethical Principles USA TODAY Network Style Guide Responsible Disclosure Subscription Terms & Conditions Advertiser Acceptance Policy Terms of Service Privacy Policy California Notice at Collection Your Privacy Choices Contact Us Support Local Businesses Promote your Event Buy and Sell Licensing & Reprints Help Center Subscriber Guide Manage Account Advertise Your Business Give Feedback Subscribe Today Newsletters Mobile Apps Facebook X eNewspaper Archives Jobs Real Estate Classifieds Education Shopping 10BEST LocaliQ Digital Marketing Solutions © 2025 www.tcpalm.com. What's Happening Home About Our Community What's Happening Design Review Board Portal Access for Residents Contact Us What's Happening Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Slide title Write your caption here Button Cobb's Landing Little Lending Library ﻿ Cobb's Landing Community has an official Little Lending Library! A voluntary fundraiser was successfully organized to purchase this weather resistant Little Library plus post. It is installed at the Marina park, at the entrance of the playground.  Feel free to borrow books and drop them off to be lent! Children's books are particularly appreciated. Food Truck on Select Fridays Various food trucks are invited to our Marina parking lot to participate Check this page monthly for MENU and pre-order link for that month's food truck. Or place an order when you arrive. Food trucks open for in-person ordering and pick up at 5pm. Take home a delicious dinner for the family or enjoy eating in the park at a picnic table with neighbors and friends. LINK to MENU  + Pre-ORDERS Bulk Trash Schedule Free pick up offered quarterly 2025 Bulk trash pickup dates are: Jan 25, 2025 April 26, 2025 July 26, 2025 October 25, 2025 Please place items at your curb the night before to assure they are picked up. NO hazardous items such as: NO modern TV or computer electronics, NO batteries or tires, NO construction debris, NO landscape waste, and NO paint or solvents. (See hazardous drop off site info below). REGULAR TRASH PICKUP is twice a week on Tuesdays and Fridays. Recycle is on Wednesdays. There are only three Holidays whereby trash pickup is delayed by one day: Thanksgiving, Christmas Day and New Year's Day. Trash service is fully included in your annual assessment. Hazardous Items drop off Button Cobb's Landing NEW Community Pier is Finished! The Cobb's Landing Community Pier is finally open to Cobb's Landing residents. Residents have the option to be assigned a KEY FOB for Gate Entry. Just like our other amenities, the New Pier Key Fobs are the property of Cobb's Landing and will be issued to homeowners who submit a signed Community Pier Gate Key Fob agreement with a required $50 refundable deposit. CLICK HERE for Community Pier key AGREEMENT form. The re-design was commissioned in December 2022 to repair and re-plank the inside finger pier to keep the existing 12 usable boat slips, bringing the total boat slips to 28, and to remodel the outside finger pier into an 85 foot long flat platform for broader Community use as a waterfront viewing pier for coffee in the morning, taking photos, fishing by residents, watching space shuttle launches, and in general enjoying this new Community amenity. FORMS and INFORMATION SHEETS COBB'S LANDING MARINA Marina Boat Slips are available to lease by residents for $550 plus tax per year, with an additional one time $50 refundable deposit for a Marina Gate key. Currently there are 28 boat slips available for leasing. All keys are the property of Cobb's Landing. If all slips are leased, a waiting list is established. A gated Community Marina Ramp is available for use by Cobb's Landing residents only. There is a one time $150 refundable deposit for a Marina Ramp key. Many residents use the ramp to launch boats or jet skis kept in their garage or elsewhere. Ramp keys are the property of Cobb's Landing. There is NO fishing. NO diving, and NO swimming allowed from the current Marina pier or boardwalks due to strict insurance mandate.. Fishing is allowed at the new Community pier by residents from the large platform at the end. And of course fishing is fully allowed on Lake Tarpon in boats taken out into the lake, not moored. FORMS and INFORMATION SHEETS MARINA PARK RULES and REGULATIONS NEW COMMUNITY PIER GATE KEY AGREEMENT MARINA BOAT SLIP LEASE CONTRACT ADDENDUM to prior BOAT SLIP LEASE (existing lessees only) RAMP USAGE LICENSE AGREEMENT OTHER COBB'S LANDING FORMS & INFO TENNIS COURT KEY FOB REQUEST form TENNIS COURT RULES Sheet COBB'S LANDING MAIL BOX Specification Sheet REQUEST FOR NEW MAILBOX SWAN DECALS (free) AUTHORIZED "HOME FOR SALE" SIGNS (for realtors or homeowners) DRB APPLICATION for all EXTERIOR CHANGES EMAIL CONSENT FORM (authorizing M&A communication by email) CHANGE OF ADDRESS, EMAIL OR PHONE NOTICE to M&A(send any updates) Share by:

About Fintech Fintech has been dedicated to serving the beverage alcohol industry for 34 years. Supported by TA Associates and General Atlantic, Fintech stands as a foremost leader in this sector. Its flagship product, PaymentSource®, is leveraged by over 274,000 retail and hospitality businesses, as well as more than 7,700 alcohol distributors, vendors, and suppliers… Contact Close Contact Open Contact Connect with Sales sales@fintech.com (813) 288-1980 (Option 2) Client Support / Activation support@fintech.com activation@fintech.com (813) 288-1980 (option 1) Login Get Started Drinking Buddies: Cobb’s Landing / Little Jim Bait & Tackle Written By: Matthew Bruner Category: Drinking Buddies , General , Retailers For our latest Drinking Buddies feature, we sat down with Donna Qvarnstrom, owner and operator of Cobb’s Landing and Little Jim Bait & Tackle in Fort Pierce, FL. Both are successful businesses in their own right and feature fresh seafood, craft cocktails, live entertainment, and history. Drinking Buddies Interview How long have you been in the hospitality business? What is your background? “I have been in the hospitality business for 38 years. I started as a server at 20 and have worked every position in the industry, including Food Service Distribution, and have worked my way up to ownership.” Can you tell us the story about Cobb’s Landing? How did it get started? “I worked for the owners of TIki Bar & Restaurant in Fort Pierce, and in 2005, an opportunity to purchase the Cobb’s Landing restaurant came about. We opened the restaurant in January of 2006 and have been serving the Fort Pierce community since.” And what about Little Jim Bait & Tackle? “Little Jim Bait & Tackle is a historical icon of Fort Pierce, serving the Navy Seals back in WWII. The former owners were looking to retire and we were lucky enough to obtain the lease in 2019.” Can you tell us more about the menus at both locations? “We are constantly evolving with our menus to keep up with the changes and demands in today’s world. We try to know our customers and what they are looking for, which helps guide us.” “Cobb’s Landing features a variety of fresh seafood dishes, including tacos, entrees, a raw bar, and more.” Ahi Tuna Salad – Cobb’s Landing Coconut Shrimp – Cobb’s Landing “The menu at Little Jim is very casual, and we have items ranging from boiled peanuts to tacos and everything in between.  We also recently started our Breakfast on the weekends.” Pork Tacos – Little Jim Bait & Tackle What is your favorite menu item at each location? “At Cobb’s, my favorite has to be the Poke Bowl. At Little Jim, it’s definitely the Blackened Shrimp Tacos.” You have a nice selection of craft cocktails at each location. Can you tell us about the drink menu? “Our bar menus are so great!  We have a great infusion selection, along with our bourbon and tequilas. Our Craft Cocktails are collaborative between our bartenders, managers, and myself. We often try seasonal cocktails, too.” “At Little Jim, we have the ‘Lost in Paradise’ cocktail menu. It’s a collection of our customers’ favorite beverages like the Pullin Drag & Summergirl, which are both local charter boats that bring their clients to Little Jim. In addition, we have some longtime favorite creations like the Black Cherry Cooler.” There is also a variety of mocktails available. Is that something new that you are trying? “We added Mocktails a couple of years ago as the ” Taking a Break “movement from alcohol has become huge, and when you are the DD or choose not to drink, you still want to be able to have a cool beverage to sip on.” What is your go-to cocktail? “I’m a tequila girl, so my go-to is a Komos Rose Reposado on the rocks. But our Signature Pineapple Mojito is awesome. Little Jim’s Black Cherry Cooler is my favorite at that location, with the Pain Killer being a close second.” Has live entertainment always been a part of your hospitality business? “Yes, we have had live music for over 14 years. Over the last 2 years, we have incorporated it into a daily event.  Most of our acts are local or have local ties to the area. 95% are from Florida.” “We also have some amazing entertainment at Little Jim. We have music daily and twice a day on Saturdays & Sundays. Some of our favorites are Aquinas from Melbourne Beach and the Leafy Greens out of Jupiter. We also have our Own Live Bait (Will & Dave) from Ft Pierce. Our entertainment calendar is located on our website.” The Leafy Greens Band at Little Jim Bait & Tackle Can you tell us more about the Banquet Room for private events at Cobb’s Landing? “Our private room upstairs seats 65 with a full bar and restrooms. We are booked 75% of the year with weddings, rehearsal dinners, bridal & baby showers, business meetings, and birthday celebrations.” What about the actual bait and tackle aspect of Little Jim? I’m sure it is a popular spot for local fishermen and tourists before going out. “We have an array of Live Bait (Shrimp, Pin Fish, Pig Fish, croakers) along with frozen bait. We also carry everything you need to load up your tackle box if you forgot anything from hooks, Mono & fluorocarbon, rod & reel combos, and, of course, sunglasses and sunscreen because we always seem to forget that at home.” I saw there is a campaign to save Little Jim from redevelopment in the area. Can you tell us more about that and how people can help? “We are trying to get the site listed on the Historical registry.   It served as a guard shack for the Navy in the 40’s, and we believe the spot should always remain the same. People can vote on change.org .” How has Fintech helped with managing your alcohol program? “It has streamlined our invoices, especially with having them in a digital format and being able to track your credits and pricing to keep on top of today’s rising prices. I find the real-time banking activity and managing your credits the most useful because, in this business, every dollar counts in managing your cash flow and ensuring that you know what product is coming in and out of your store.” We thank Donna for her time and for the chance to speak about Cobb’s Landing and Little Jim Bait & Tackle. If you ever find yourself in Fort Pierce, FL, do yourself a favor and enjoy a fresh cocktail with the ocean breeze and some live entertainment. Check out the websites for Cobb’s Landing and Little Jim for more information. Share to your social media. Facebook LinkedIn X Get Started Today! Fill out the form to connect with a Fintech team member. Cobb's Landing accommodates diners no matter what the weather brings News Indian River Martin St. Lucie Sports Advertise Obits eNewspaper Legals DINING Fort Pierce's Cobb's Landing accommodates diners no matter what the weather brings Lucie Regensdorf Special to TCPalm One Sunday when it didn't look as if it was going to rain, we visited Cobb’s Landing, lured by the bottomless mimosas for $12. The restaurant has three dining options. Besides indoor dining which lacks atmosphere, there is tiki dining undercover and outfitted with breezy fans as well as true outdoor dining where you can dine with your dog. I am all about al fresco dining, especially when the atmosphere is rustic and open, and the view is water with a lovely marina. Looking for a free mini puzzle? Play the USA TODAY Quick Cross now. As we perused the menu, a duo with guitars pleasantly strummed in the background. We shared the Garlic and Herb Wood Grilled Summer Artichokes ($14). We dipped the tender, lemony, pulpy artichokes in Cajun remoulade which was a spicy, pickle aioli. Our artichoke-authority-friends declared them to be the “best ever.” We also shared the Caribbean Chicken Wings ($14). The wings were grilled, not fried, so they were not greasy. The Caribbean spices infused the chicken with sweet flavor. The Island Aioli (which tasted like Chipotle Ranch) was a great accompaniment. The Bourbon Street Gumbo ($6 cup and $8 bowl) was nicely spicy with plentiful chunks of crab, shrimp, andouille sausage, okra, and the “Louisiana Holy Trinity” of onions, peppers and celery. My husband ordered the Southwest Steak Salad ($22). The beef tenderloin was medium rare, tender, and full of wood-grilled flavor. The greens were dressed with roasted corn and black bean salsa, fire roasted peppers, Cotjita cheese (a hard-Mexican cheese), and chili pepper ranch dressing. One friend chose the fresh catch of the day sandwich which was cobia ($24) caught in Jupiter. Fish is offered blackened, grilled, sautéed or fried. The generous piece of cobia was succulent, firm, and juicy. The other friend ordered the Artisan BLT ($14). Artisan is not a typical adjective used to describe a BLT. However, its use is proper for this well-crafted, hearty French toast version.The thickly sliced Parmesan and chive sour dough bread was dipped in a batter, griddled, and piled with avocado and apple-wood smoked bacon. The sandwich was a delicious sweet and savory creation. I ordered the Kennebunkport Surf & Turf Burger ($19). The butter poached and wood grilled Maine lobster claws plus a whipped goat cheese and mustard aioli sat on top of a thick, yummy, perfectly cooked burger. The lobster was decadent and rich. All sandwiches are served with crispy skinny herb and Parmesan fries, house potato chips or coleslaw. For dessert, we shared the Key Lime Pie ($8). The plate was decorated with icing and sugar crystals which made a beautiful presentation. The filling had a nice tangy flavor and texture, but the graham cracker crust was too thick in relation to the filling. Cobb’s Landing's food  is artisanal, creative, locally-sourced and fresh. Clearly, the chef enjoys the craft of originality in creating good food. Don’t worry if it’s one of those all too common rainy days. You can sit outside but undercover and enjoy one of their specialty drinks. MORE: Check out restaurant inspections on the Treasure Coast Lucie Regensdorf  dines anonymously at the expense of TCPalm for #WhatToDoIn772. Contact her at Lucie@theloveofcooking.com or follow @LucieLovesFood on Twitter. Cobb’s Landing Cuisine: Fresh local seafood and Angus beef plus daily specials Address: 200 North Indian River Drive, Fort Pierce Phone: 772-460-9014 Hours: 11 a.m.-10 p.m. Sunday through Thursday; 11 a.m.-11 p.m. Friday and Saturday.
